pullRequest.title: Metadata PATCH when mixing plain text and relationship
pullRequest.bodyText:
While working with the submission, we noticed a few problems with metadata PATCH when mixing plain text and relationship
This contains fixes for those PATCH requests and ITs
The pure plain-text PATCHes are also still working correctly, there were ITs for those use cases

nodes.bodyText: This post needs to be updated to cleanup after itself.  Remember the (newer) best practices to use an andDo in a try/finally, similar to this test: https://github.com/DSpace/DSpace/blob/main/dspace-server-webapp/src/test/java/org/dspace/app/rest/RelationshipRestRepositoryIT.java#L278

Again, this post needs to be updated to cleanup after itself.  In this scenario, since there are two posts here, you could have a try/finally around essentially most of this test method & do cleanup of both after the assertions below

Just a note, this sort of assertion is easier to read/understand (and shorter) if you use assertEquals() instead of the longer assertThat(...., equalTo()).  It's not a required change, but I find it slightly easier to read.
It looks (to me) like we are always testing with mixed content...some Entities, and some textual authors.  Could we add a few basic tests to verify this patching also works for only textual authors?
